<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GOVERNANCE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/12/musk-faces-legal-questions-solarcity-acquisition?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Who Really Controls Tesla?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/12/musk-faces-legal-questions-solarcity-acquisition?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Elon Musk SNL" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=376 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/QLlbsC0Pu2iYULBry4/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Elon Musk SNL" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/QLlbsC0Pu2iYULBry4/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">One billionaire flew to space this weekend. Others were trying to resolve more mundane problems here at sea level.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Like <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/07/10/tesla-ceo-musk-goes-to-trial-monday-on-2point6-billion-solarcity-deal.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shareholder lawsuits</a>. Elon Musk will testify today in a high-stakes trial where he’s accused of using one of his companies (Tesla) to bail out another of his companies (SolarCity), enriching himself and leaving shareholders holding the bag.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>In 2016, electric vehicle maker Tesla bought solar energy startup SolarCity for $2.6 billion, aiming to build a single, integrated sustainable energy company. Musk didn’t need much due diligence before buying SolarCity—after all, his cousins founded it in 2006 and Musk served as the chairman. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But SolarCity was in bad financial shape, losing money and holding more than $3 billion in debt. And investors weren’t particularly enthusiastic about the deal. After the acquisition was announced, Tesla shares fell more than 10%, wiping out more value ($3 billion) than the entire purchase price for SolarCity. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The details</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The lawsuit alleges that Tesla’s acquisition of SolarCity reeked with <a href="https://apnews.com/article/business-3cf631c55b15ec9f83b2306c7fb2e89d?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">conflicts of interest</a> and that Musk failed to disclose liquidity problems at SolarCity.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Musk’s counterargument is this: Look, the board approved it. Musk only owned about 22% each of Tesla and SolarCity at the time of the deal, meaning he wasn’t a corporate autocrat who could combine his two companies without oversight.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Also, if you haven’t checked lately, Tesla stock is currently 15x its price when the company purchased SolarCity...so how was this bad for Tesla shareholders exactly? </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The “why it matters” part</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If Musk loses, he could be asked to cough up the full amount of the transaction—$2.6 billion. That’d be one of the largest judgments ever against an individual.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But beyond that, the trial raises bigger questions about how much control tech moguls have over decision-making at their companies. As Reuters <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/musk-trial-asks-2-billion-101450618.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">asks</a>, “Does Elon Musk control Tesla Inc., or does Tesla control Elon Musk?”</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPACE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/12/branson-virgin-galactic-complete-highstakes-space-flight?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Now Back to Billionaires In Space
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/12/branson-virgin-galactic-complete-highstakes-space-flight?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Branson and crew celebrating the completion of a space flight " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NzMwL2JyYW5zb25fYW5kX2NyZXdfY2VsZWJyYXRpbmdfdGhlX2NvbXBsZXRpb25fb2ZfYV9zcGFjZV9mbGlnaHQuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>PATRICK T. FALLON/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As Elon Musk looked on, Richard Branson and five other crew members successfully completed a <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/07/11/science/richard-branson-virgin-galactic-space.html?action=click&module=Top%20Stories&pgtype=Homepage" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">flight to space</a>, a milestone for Virgin Galactic and the young space tourism industry.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Branson and crew flew 53.5 miles in the air, unbuckled and floated around for a bit, and descended back to Earth before enjoying the more traditional Sunday morning activity of drowning yourself in champagne.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Yesterday’s was the first mission that mimics the commercial flights Virgin Galactic hopes to launch soon. About 600 well-heeled customers who’ve paid at least $200,000 each are eagerly awaiting their opportunity to follow in Branson's footsteps.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">One more thing: </strong>Our colleagues at Gossip Brew wouldn’t let us publish this story without acknowledging that billionaire Jeff Bezos will fly to space in a Blue Origin rocket in just over a week. “Can’t wait to join the club!” Bezos <a href="https://www.instagram.com/p/CRMbI07HmxB/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wrote</a> in a congratulatory Instagram post after Branson’s flight. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TAX
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/12/global-tax-reform-update?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Global Tax Reform Update
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt='An illustration of a Monopoly board. The space for taxes shows "Corporate Tax: Pay 21% or $200" with the 21% crossed out in red pen and 28% written beside it. ' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NDAzL2NvcnBvcmF0ZV90YXhlcy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Overhauling the international tax system takes longer than loading a webpage in 1995, but countries <em>are</em> making progress. Leaders from 20 of the world’s largest economies <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/07/10/us/politics/global-tax-overhaul-g20.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">endorsed</a> a plan over the weekend, continuing the momentum after 132 countries approved it earlier this month. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The plan:</strong> It would <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/global-tax-deal-heads-down-perilous-path-in-congress-11626008186?mod=hp_lead_pos2" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">introduce</a> a 15% minimum tax rate globally, eliminating the strategy some countries have used of dropping their corporate tax rate to attract business HQs.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why it matters: </strong>A 15% floor would make it easier for the Biden administration to raise taxes on corporations in the US, since it’ll be harder for companies to find more attractive rates elsewhere. Biden wants to collect up to $2 trillion in revenue from corporate tax increases over the next decade. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Now comes the hard part</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Advocates will need to sway holdout countries, including Ireland and Hungary, which successfully leveraged low tax rates to propel their economies forward. If they can be brought on board, the biggest challenge of all looms: convincing Congress this plan would be beneficial for the US economy. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the plan won’t be ready to present to American lawmakers until <a href="https://www.reuters.com/business/uss-yellen-says-expects-finalize-tax-changes-large-firms-2022-2021-07-11/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">next year</a>, Secretary Yellen said.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/12/key-performance-indicators-july-12?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/12/key-performance-indicators-july-12?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Black Widow scene" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NzI5L2JsYWNrX3dpZG93LmpwZWciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Disney/Marvel</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat:</strong> Marvel’s <em>Black Widow</em> scored <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/07/11/black-widow-opening-weekend-highest-pandemic-box-office-opening-.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$80 million</a> at the box office this weekend, the best opening for a movie since the pandemic began. But even more interestingly, the film also generated more than $60 million in revenue through sales on Disney+ Premier Access, the first time the company has shared financial details about streaming releases. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“I knew the drought was bad. I didn’t realize it was this bad. This place is unrecognizable.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Fisherman Eric Richins described the <a href="https://www.latimes.com/world-nation/story/2021-07-11/lake-mead-hoover-dam-drought-nevada-arizona-california?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">water crisis</a> at Lake Mead to the LA Times. Next month, the government will likely declare the first-ever water shortage for the lake, a reservoir that supplies water to farmers in California, Nevada, California, and Mexico. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>Tripping in LSD’s birthplace. (<a href="https://blogs.scientificamerican.com/cross-check/tripping-in-lsds-birthplace-a-story-for-e2809cbicycle-daye2809d/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Scientific American</a>)</p>

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOne billionaire flew to space this weekend. Others were trying to resolve more mundane problems here at sea level.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLike \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/07/10/tesla-ceo-musk-goes-to-trial-monday-on-2point6-billion-solarcity-deal.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshareholder lawsuits\u003c/a\u003e. Elon Musk will testify today in a high-stakes trial where he’s accused of using one of his companies (Tesla) to bail out another of his companies (SolarCity), enriching himself and leaving shareholders holding the bag.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eIn 2016, electric vehicle maker Tesla bought solar energy startup SolarCity for $2.6 billion, aiming to build a single, integrated sustainable energy company. Musk didn’t need much due diligence before buying SolarCity—after all, his cousins founded it in 2006 and Musk served as the chairman. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut SolarCity was in bad financial shape, losing money and holding more than $3 billion in debt. And investors weren’t particularly enthusiastic about the deal. After the acquisition was announced, Tesla shares fell more than 10%, wiping out more value ($3 billion) than the entire purchase price for SolarCity. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe details\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe lawsuit alleges that Tesla’s acquisition of SolarCity reeked with \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/business-3cf631c55b15ec9f83b2306c7fb2e89d?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econflicts of interest\u003c/a\u003e and that Musk failed to disclose liquidity problems at SolarCity.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMusk’s counterargument is this: Look, the board approved it. Musk only owned about 22% each of Tesla and SolarCity at the time of the deal, meaning he wasn’t a corporate autocrat who could combine his two companies without oversight.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAlso, if you haven’t checked lately, Tesla stock is currently 15x its price when the company purchased SolarCity...so how was this bad for Tesla shareholders exactly? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe “why it matters” part\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf Musk loses, he could be asked to cough up the full amount of the transaction—$2.6 billion. That’d be one of the largest judgments ever against an individual.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut beyond that, the trial raises bigger questions about how much control tech moguls have over decision-making at their companies. As Reuters \u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/musk-trial-asks-2-billion-101450618.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003easks\u003c/a\u003e, “Does Elon Musk control Tesla Inc., or does Tesla control Elon Musk?”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS FALLON/AFP via Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs Elon Musk looked on, Richard Branson and five other crew members successfully completed a \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/07/11/science/richard-branson-virgin-galactic-space.html?action=click\u0026module=Top%20Stories\u0026pgtype=Homepage\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eflight to space\u003c/a\u003e, a milestone for Virgin Galactic and the young space tourism industry.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBranson and crew flew 53.5 miles in the air, unbuckled and floated around for a bit, and descended back to Earth before enjoying the more traditional Sunday morning activity of drowning yourself in champagne.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eYesterday’s was the first mission that mimics the commercial flights Virgin Galactic hopes to launch soon. About 600 well-heeled customers who’ve paid at least $200,000 each are eagerly awaiting their opportunity to follow in Branson's footsteps.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOne more thing: \u003c/strong\u003eOur colleagues at Gossip Brew wouldn’t let us publish this story without acknowledging that billionaire Jeff Bezos will fly to space in a Blue Origin rocket in just over a week. “Can’t wait to join the club!” Bezos \u003ca href=\"https://www.instagram.com/p/CRMbI07HmxB/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrote\u003c/a\u003e in a congratulatory Instagram post after Branson’s flight. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F07%2F12%2Fbranson-virgin-galactic-complete-highstakes-space-flight\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; The space for taxes shows \"Corporate Tax: Pay 21% or $200\" with the 21% crossed out in red pen and 28% written beside it. ' style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NDAzL2NvcnBvcmF0ZV90YXhlcy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOverhauling the international tax system takes longer than loading a webpage in 1995, but countries \u003cem\u003eare\u003c/em\u003e making progress. Leaders from 20 of the world’s largest economies \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/07/10/us/politics/global-tax-overhaul-g20.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eendorsed\u003c/a\u003e a plan over the weekend, continuing the momentum after 132 countries approved it earlier this month. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe plan:\u003c/strong\u003e It would \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/global-tax-deal-heads-down-perilous-path-in-congress-11626008186?mod=hp_lead_pos2\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eintroduce\u003c/a\u003e a 15% minimum tax rate globally, eliminating the strategy some countries have used of dropping their corporate tax rate to attract business HQs.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy it matters: \u003c/strong\u003eA 15% floor would make it easier for the Biden administration to raise taxes on corporations in the US, since it’ll be harder for companies to find more attractive rates elsewhere. Biden wants to collect up to $2 trillion in revenue from corporate tax increases over the next decade. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eNow comes the hard part\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAdvocates will need to sway holdout countries, including Ireland and Hungary, which successfully leveraged low tax rates to propel their economies forward. If they can be brought on board, the biggest challenge of all looms: convincing Congress this plan would be beneficial for the US economy. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe plan won’t be ready to present to American lawmakers until \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/business/uss-yellen-says-expects-finalize-tax-changes-large-firms-2022-2021-07-11/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enext year\u003c/a\u003e, Secretary Yellen said.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable
